required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Results of Small Incision Lenticule Extraction (SMILE) for the Correction of High Myopia
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Results of Small Incision Lenticule Extraction (SMILE) for the Correction of High Myopia

brief_summary.textblock:
Small Incision Lenticule Extraction (SMILE) was introduced in 2011 using the VISUMAX femtosecond laser (Carl Zeiss Meditec, Jena, Germany). It is designed for correction of myopia and myopic astigmatism.
It involves the creation of a corneal tissue disk called lenticule and its extraction through a minimally invasive incision, utilizing only a femtosecond laser. This enables rapid visual recovery with very little discomfort to the patient.
This observational case series monitors visual and refractive outcomes of myopic correction for more than -7.75 D.
It is to
- gather long-term results and refractive stability
- detect rare complications or side-effects
- evaluate the efficacy in a large number of patients

primary_outcome.description: Visual Acuity sine and cum correctione

secondary_outcome.measure: Tectonic stability as assessed by Pentacam
secondary_outcome.description: Corneal tectonic stability post surgery as assesed by Scheimpflug-Tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Epithelial thickness map in Optical coherence tomography
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Thickness of epithelium pre and post surgery

arm_group.description: SMILE - Correction of eyes with myopia of more than -7.75 D

intervention.intervention_name: Small Incision Lenticule Extraction (SMILE) with Visumax (Carl Zeiss Meditec, Jena)
intervention.description: Creation of a corneal tissue disk called lenticule and extraction through a minimally invasive incision, utilizing only a femtosecond laser

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with myopia more than -7.75 D seeking refractive surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults
- myopia more than -7.75 D
- refractive stability more than 1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
- corneal irregular astigmatism
- ectatic conditions
